numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph has an evident feature.
2. The amount of people aged 15-24 who believe that the world gets better with each generation is very large.
3. This amount is larger than the amount for people who are 40 years old or older.
4. Some countries are inside the 40+ boundary.
5. These countries are in Africa and Asia.
6. These countries are not in Europe.
7. These countries are not in the Americas.
8. I ask whether this fact shows that middle-aged adults are more confident in their successors than adults in the West.
9. The younger generations feel better about themselves than the older generations.
10. Young people and older people disagree about the future.
11. This disagreement is alarming.
12. I wonder how the younger generation is so optimistic.
13. Many key development years of the younger generation were distorted by the pandemic.
14. Adults lived through decades without worrying about the virus.
15. I ask whether adults should be more hopeful that things will go back to normal.
16. This situation affects me and my community.
17. I grew up during the pandemic.
18. My life was affected by the pandemic.
19. I am a member of the 15-24 age group.
20. People in the 15-24 age group have been able to find hope and happiness.
21. Many negative things have been happening in the world.
22. I think that it is important that older generations find hope and happiness too.
23. The headline is: Are teens and young adults better than their predecessors?
